page.title: 01SOUTH EAST OF BRAMPTON BRYAN
page.content: This is a plain bounded to the north by the River Teine. It is in a beautiful unspoilt agricultural area surrounded by tree clad hills. Although farmed fairly intensively the land is divided into fields of five to twenty acres by hedges containing a number of broad leaved trees. The pretty village of Brampton Bryan is renowned for its timber and thatched cottages. The hall and cattle ruins are surrounded by a huge undulating yew hedge. The hamlets of Letton Walford and Newton consist of farms and cottages.
